abstract.text: Contains the configuration data for a view controller that lets the user add a payment pass.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The encryption scheme, cardholder name, and primary account suffix are required for configuration. The configuration information is used for setup and display only. It should not contain any sensitive information.

Adding payment passes requires a special entitlement issued by Apple. Your app must include this entitlement before you can use this class. For more information on requesting this entitlement, see the Card Issuers section at

abstract.text: Process Apple Pay payments in your app, and create and distribute passes for the Wallet app.
Contains the configuration data for a view controller that lets the user add a payment pass.
An array of labeled values that describe a card.
The name of the person as shown on the card.
The encryption scheme to be used in this request.
Instantiates a new request configuration with the given encryption scheme.
A short description of the card.
The payment network.
A primary account identifier, used to filter out pass libraries.
The last four or five digits of the card’s number.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the payment pass requires the Felica Secure Element.
A value that indicates whether a pass is for access or for payment use.
The type of payment pass.
Returns an initialized add payment view controller object, using the provided configuration and delegate.
Encryption schemes.
An object that can represent a detail about a payment card or other item.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
